pages.title: Getting Started
pages.description: All-in-one open source digital magazine starter kit with high performance and fully customizable. Built using Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind, and Strapi CMS.
pages.content:
[Magazine](https://github.com/edgarlr/magazine) is an Open Source Digital Magazine built using [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/), [TypeScript](https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/typescript), [Tailwind](https://tailwindcss.com/), and [Strapi CMS](https://strapi.io/).

The project is pre-configured to set it up and deploy it in just a few clicks. All the instructions are available on the Github repositories.

## Source Code

The project is fully open source and the source code is available on Github. The project is pre-configured for use it as a template and all the instructions to get it up and running are available on the Github repository.

[Magazine on Github](https://github.com/edgarlr/magazine)

## CMS
The project was built using Strapi CMS which is an Open Source and Self-hosted headless CMS. 

[Magazine Strapi Template](https://github.com/edgarlr/strapi-template-magazine) contains all the instruction to bootstrap your project and then you can configure the [media upload provider](https://strapi.io/documentation/developer-docs/latest/development/plugins/upload.html) of your preference and [deploy it](https://strapi.io/documentation/developer-docs/latest/setup-deployment-guides/deployment.html) wherever you prefer.

[Magazine Heroku](https://github.com/edgarlr/magazine-api) is the Strapi CMS pre-configured with [Cloudinary](https://cloudinary.com/) as media upload provider and ready for production. You can deploy it to Heroku with just **one click**

## Deployment
You can use the platform of your preference. 

For this demo I'm using [Vercel](https://vercel.com) for the frontend and [Heroku](https://www.heroku.com/) for the CMS.

pages.title: Features
pages.description: All-in-one open source digital magazine starter kit with high performance and fully customizable. Built using Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind, and Strapi CMS.
pages.content:
[Magazine](https://github.com/edgarlr/magazine) is an Open Source and fully customizable digital magazine. 

The project was built using [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/), [TypeScript](https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/typescript), [Tailwind](https://tailwindcss.com/), and [Strapi CMS](https://strapi.io/).

## General Features

- Great Performance
- Clean Design
- SEO and Social Media Friendly
- PWA Friendly. **Installable**
- **Light** and **Dark** Theme
- Fully Responsive
- Save articles and read them **offline**
- Offline support
- Fully customizable
- Share post menu
- Google Analytics

## For Editors

- Publication System (Draft & published)
- Preview Unpublished Content (Articles and pages).
- **2 Contributor** types (Featured and default).
- Role-based access controls

## Other features

- Slug System
- Dynamically generated sitemap
- Search module and hooks.
- Automatic dark version depending on the system settings
- Custom 404 Page
- Custom Offline Page
- Author Page
- Category (tag) Page
- Slider for featured posts on mobile view
- Self-hosted fonts
- UI Components (Toast, Menu, Drawer, etc.)

## Credits

Developed by: [Edgar López](https://github.com/edgarlr).

Designed by: [Edgar López](https://www.figma.com/@edgarlr) and [Fabrizzio Moncada](https://www.figma.com/@fabrizzio).

All photos used in the theme demo are from [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/)
